Condition Sampling Protocol, Smolt Monit:
Monitoring Techniques
Condition sampling involves identifying proportions of each species of migrant juvenile salmon with injuries or problems in fish passage at dams. It also collects data on fish disease, predation, and other injuries to provide relative indication of fish health. Therefore, it falls under the category of Monitoring Techniques as it is a method used for monitoring the condition of fish populations.
